definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands

sentences.english: There was a moment of silence, then everyone but the Princess began to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 片刻寂靜之後，皇族貴胄們鬨堂大笑，除了公主。

sentences.english: They make the circus lively and cause people to laugh。
sentences.chinese: 他們使馬戲充滿生氣，使觀衆捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: Pardon me, hounded hope, for laughing from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 被追獵的希望啊，原諒我不時大笑。

sentences.english: He more than smiled. He laughed a lot.
sentences.chinese: 他豈止是微笑，簡直是大笑。
西頓夫人大笑着表示同意。

sentences.english: The first time he mentioned her. Gus started to shake his head and laugh.
sentences.chinese: 第一次提起她的時候，蓋斯搖着頭大笑起來。

sentences.english: The Qiao son really thinks cachinnation, although she is terrified to horrify this to adopt to spend a thief.
sentences.chinese: 巧兒很想大笑，不過她怕嚇到了這個採花賊。

sentences.english: Grandpa threw back his head and laughed. Amusement danced in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 爺爺仰着頭大笑起來，眼神裏滿是得意之情。
她停下，大笑了起來，看起來很訝異。

sentences.english: Why did Berk have a good laugh at Allan’s expense?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼伯克大笑艾倫的花費？

sentences.english: The clown panicked the audience with a gag.
sentences.chinese: 小丑插科打諢逗得觀衆大笑。

sentences.english: I don't have a plan. Except, it's time my mom laughed again.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽再次開懷大笑的時候，我纔有了新計劃。

sentences.english: My life is just…one big joke.
sentences.chinese: 我的人生只是一個大笑話。

sentences.english: In the comic dialogue, two performers revealed the joke suddenly, which made the audience convulse with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 相聲演員不時抖包袱，令現場觀衆捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: He made us all laugh by mimicking the teacher's voice.
sentences.chinese: 他模仿老師的聲音，逗得我們哈哈大笑。

definition: to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to howl with laughter/to laugh one's head off
very loudly/at the top of one's voice
to giggle/to laugh foolishly/to smirk/to simper
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to be laughing and playing/to giggle
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
